### Instructor

![](images/team/florian-shkurti.jpg){style="float:right;padding: 0 0 0 10px;" width="200"}

[**Florian Shkurti**](https://www.cs.toronto.edu/~florian/) is an assistant professor in computer science at the University of Toronto, where he leads the [Robot Vision and Learning lab](http://rvl.cs.toronto.edu/). He is a faculty member of the University of Toronto Robotics Institute, the Acceleration Consortium, and a faculty affiliate at Vector Institute. His research group develops methods that enable robots to learn to perceive, reason, plan, and act effectively and safely, particularly in dynamic environments and alongside humans. Application areas of his research include field robotics for environmental monitoring, visual navigation for autonomous vehicles, and mobile manipulation.
